column4: can v make a usb startup disk for linux ubuntu 9.10 server edition?
i tried to copy the .iso image file from a disk to create a live usb using the creator. but the usb wasn't working when i tried to install. do i need to first write the image to a cd
no. just have a iso image and follow standard procedure with unetbootin
if server edition cant be use on usb then you cant, but if you officialy can, then you are not doing well procedures
ahh, does trying takes money? no? then just try? its matter of 5-10 mins? pleaes try first
you tried? and it is not working?
yes i did. it showed that the process completed successfully. then when i tried to boot a PC with the usb it said no boot-able files found. reboot or insert disk.
hmm. that's the thing. its not mentioned even in the LTSP documentation. well lets see.
i've started the process of creating another usb startup disk. let's see where that leads me. i'll still go through the link.
stop that and see that link first. link may have important info. and do remember to do google always first
